project.description: Generic plan to create Red Hat Enterprise Linux builds

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: PUSH_USER
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The username to use when pushing artefacts to the satellite. The build job will need to be able to ssh to the satellite as this user so you need to have keys set up.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: RSA_ID
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: RSA ID of the Jenkins user.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: KNOWN_HOSTS
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Known hosts file of the Jenkins user.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: SATELLITE
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The FQDN of the Red Hat Satellite.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: ORG
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: This is the name of the organisation you are using on the Red Hat Satellite.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: REPO_ID
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The numeric ID of the RPM repository on the Red Hat Satellite that you want to use for your custom RPMs.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: PUPPET_REPO_ID
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The numeric ID of the puppet module repository on the Red Hat Satellite that you want to use for your custom puppet modules.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: TESTVM_HOSTCOLLECTION
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The name of the Satellite 6 host collection containing your test machines.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: TESTVM_ENV
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description:
The numeric ID of the environment you want to promote CI builds to. This will typically be a 'Crash' or 'EngTest' environment.
You can find the IDs of your environments using: hammer lifecycle-environment list --organization "Default_Organization"

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: TEST_ROOT
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: This is the root password of your test machines, as set in your hostgroup definition.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: YUM_REPO
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: This is the location of the Yum repository on the Jenkins server used to export RPMs to the satellite server.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: PUPPET_REPO
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: This is the location of the puppet repository on the Jenkins server used to export puppet modules to the satellite server.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: CV
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: This is the name of the Content View on the satellite that you want to publish your build into.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: CV_PASSIVE_LIST
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: A comma separated list of content view names to publish and optionally promote as part of the build. Those CVs won't get new Puppet Modules assigned to them, meaning you must (and are free to) assign (and unassign) them yourself directly in Satellite.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: CCV_NAME_PATTERN
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Enter here a name pattern if you want Composite Content Views using the given CV(s) to be updated with the latest version and as well published and promoted. CCVs respecting the pattern but not containing any CV will not be touched. Example of pattern: "ccv-test-*"

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: CONDITIONAL_VM_BUILD
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description:
If this parameter is true/set, only the hosts existing in Satellite with a comment matching the modified Puppet module, RPM package or kickstart file, each surrounded by hashes (#), will be built and tested.
Examples: #ssh#bats#kickstart.erb#
CAUTION: be aware that in this case, no host will be tested if only the scripts have been modified.
If unset/false, all existing hosts, within the given Host Collection, will be rebuilt independent of changes done in Git.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: MOCK_CONFIG
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: This will be passed to mock --root e.g. mock --root rhel-7-x86_64 needed to ensure we can build RPMs against more then just the default mock chroot.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: PUPPET_DONE_SLEEP
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Number of seconds to wait in puppet-done-test.sh if you set up things with puppet that take a while to settle (e.g. NTP), you may want to wait a bit (e.g. 75 seconds is good for ntp to settle)
